intro: Lamium barbatum, commonly known as woolly heartleaf, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It features heart-shaped leaves that are covered in soft, woolly hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces clusters of pale lavender to pink flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in woodland habitats and prefers partial shade with moist, well-drained soil. Lamium barbatum is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and blooming habit.
